name: Maido
description: An elegant establishment blending Japanese culinary techniques with Peruvian ingredients. The restaurant's name derives from a Japanese greeting phrase. Chef Tsumura creates Nikkei cuisine with increasing Amazonian influences.
applicantTips: Master Japanese-Peruvian fusion techniques and Nikkei cuisine fundamentals
Deep knowledge of Amazonian ingredients and their culinary applications essential
Experience with precision Japanese preparation methods required
Ability to adapt to evolving ingredient sourcing and menu creativity
Passion for cultural fusion and ingredient-focused cuisine valued

name: Asador Etxebarri
description: A destination restaurant in a peaceful Basque village specializing in fire-based cooking, with all dishes touched by custom-made grills designed by the chef. Emphasizes ingredient quality over molecular gastronomy.
applicantTips: Master fire-based cooking techniques and open-flame grill mastery
Deep understanding of ingredient quality and traditional Basque cooking philosophy
Experience with custom grill systems and heat management essential
Commitment to simplicity over complexity in ingredient showcasing
Technical precision and respect for ingredient-driven cuisine

name: Quintonil
description: Leading the charge of new-wave Mexican gastronomy. The restaurant focuses on contemporary Mexican cuisine using fresh, local ingredients and traditional techniques, with produce sourced from an urban garden just 30 meters away.
applicantTips: Deep knowledge of contemporary Mexican cuisine and traditional techniques
Experience with seasonal, local ingredient sourcing and farm-to-table operations
Ability to elevate traditional Mexican flavors with modern presentation
Passion for Mexican culinary innovation and gastronomic leadership
Understanding of sustainable farming and direct producer relationships

name: Diverxo
description: Edible theatre from Spain's visionary chef. Munoz creates hedonistic, creative, and unpredictable culinary experiences with theatrical courses blending Asian influences with Spanish ingredients.
applicantTips: Embrace theatrical, avant-garde culinary concepts and edible art creation
Strong creativity and ability to think beyond traditional cooking boundaries
Experience blending Asian and Spanish ingredients in innovative ways
Comfort with unpredictability and unconventional dining experiences
Passion for pushing culinary boundaries and challenging diners' expectations

name: Alchemist
description: Genre-bending, worldbuilding gastronomy featuring a unique 7-hour multi-sensory dining experience with 50 impressions divided into several acts. Dining occurs under a dome-shaped roof with changing graphics.
applicantTips: Master multi-sensory dining experiences and immersive gastronomy concepts
Experience designing extended tasting experiences (7+ hours) with theatrical elements
Strong technical skills in flavor, texture, and sensory progression
Ability to work in unique, high-concept culinary environments
Creativity in worldbuilding and narrative-driven dining experiences valued

name: Gaggan
description: India's rebel chef serves all-out creativity. The restaurant combines music, colors, and progressive Indian cuisine with French, Thai, and Japanese influences in an unconventional fine-dining experience.
applicantTips: Master progressive Indian cuisine and classical Indian cooking foundations
Experience blending French, Thai, and Japanese techniques with Indian flavors
Strong creativity and ability to break conventional culinary rules
Comfort with multi-sensory experiences incorporating music and color
Passion for reinventing tradition and challenging culinary expectations

name: Sezanne
description: Utterly delicious journey from Europe to Asia conquers hearts and palates. Neo-French culinary style enriched by Asian influences, featuring a 12-course tasting menu with extensive champagne selection.
applicantTips: Mastery of neo-French techniques and classical French culinary principles
Experience blending European refinement with Asian ingredient sophistication
Strong background in developing extended tasting menus (12+ courses)
Wine pairing and champagne service expertise highly valued
Ability to balance tradition with contemporary Asian influences

name: Table by Bruno Verjus
description: The hottest table in Paris from a self-taught chef. Features a wave-designed counter with an open kitchen, allowing diners to observe food preparation. Known for torched line-caught monkfish and chocolate tartlet with caviar.
applicantTips: Counter dining experience and open kitchen service mastery required
Excellence in French contemporary technique and ingredient sourcing
Expertise in precision techniques like torch finishing and seafood preparation
Ability to work in intimate, high-exposure counter environments
Passion for direct guest interaction and transparent cooking philosophy

name: Kjolle
description: A colourful showcase of Peruvian biodiversity. Leon focuses on Peru's vibrant ingredients while preserving natural flavors through extensive research and minimal waste practices.
applicantTips: Expert knowledge of Peruvian biodiversity and indigenous ingredients
Strong commitment to sustainability and zero-waste cooking practices
Experience in ingredient research and scientific culinary approach
Ability to preserve and enhance natural flavors with minimal intervention
Passion for showcasing Peru's vibrant culinary heritage and biodiversity

name: Don Julio
applicantTips: Mastery of Argentine beef butchery and grilling techniques essential
Deep knowledge of prime cuts and meat quality assessment
Experience in traditional wood-fired or charcoal grill operations
Ability to develop strong relationships with quality meat suppliers
Passion for celebrating Argentina's beef culture and culinary traditions

name: Wing
description: An innovative take on Chinese fine dining. Chef Cheng brings 20 years of French classical training to create contemporary interpretations of China's eight great cuisines with seasonal tasting menus.
applicantTips: Master China's eight regional cuisines and culinary techniques
French classical training combined with Chinese cuisine fundamentals valued
Experience creating seasonal tasting menus with sophisticated flavor profiles
Ability to bridge Eastern and Western culinary traditions respectfully
Strong hospitality focus and commitment to exceptional guest experiences

name: Atomix
description: Elevated Korean counter dining in Manhattan offering a 12-course tasting menu with Korean-based dishes featuring sophisticated flavor and texture combinations. Features a 14-seat U-shaped counter.
applicantTips: Mastery of Korean cooking techniques and fermented ingredient applications
Counter dining experience and intimate guest interaction skills essential
Expertise in developing multi-course tasting menus (12+ courses)
Strong ability to create sophisticated flavor and texture combinations
Dedication to Korean culinary excellence with contemporary refinement

name: Potong
description: Progressive Thai-Chinese cuisine from one of Asia's hottest chefs. The establishment emphasizes five culinary elements: salt, acid, spice, texture, and Maillard reaction.
applicantTips: Expert knowledge of Thai and Chinese cuisines with progressive techniques
Understanding of five core culinary elements: salt, acid, spice, texture, and Maillard reaction
Strong technical skills in heat management and flavor balance
Experience blending two distinct culinary traditions with sophistication
Innovation mindset combined with respect for classical foundations

name: Plenitude
description: Exquisite sauce-led cuisine delivered with relaxed precision overlooking the Seine. Features a seven-course tasting menu emphasizing sauces as the focal point.
applicantTips: Mastery of French sauce-making and classical French technique foundations
Expertise in developing balanced, elegant tasting menu progressions
Strong understanding of sauce as focal point rather than accompaniment
Exceptional precision combined with relaxed, refined presentation approach
Experience in Michelin-level fine dining with Seine River ambiance

name: Ikoyi
description: Category-free cuisine that blends herbs and spices from Africa and Asia with British produce and techniques from around the globe. Chef Chan describes the approach as a journey through bold heat.
applicantTips: Deep knowledge of West African, African, and Asian herbs and spices
Ability to work across culinary boundaries and create category-free cuisine
Experience blending African flavors with British produce and global techniques
Expertise in managing bold, intense heat and complex flavor layers
Passion for cultural fusion and challenging traditional culinary definitions

name: Lido 84
applicantTips: Master contemporary Italian cuisine with regional techniques and traditions
Strong knowledge of Italian ingredients and seasonal sourcing principles
Experience in Lake Garda region cuisine and local culinary heritage
Ability to elevate traditional Italian cooking with modern sensibilities
Dedication to ingredient quality and authentic Italian culinary values

name: Sorn
description: Genre-bending, spice-saturated southern Thai gastronomy. Chef Ice transforms flavors and memories from southern Thai cultures into innovative cuisine, characterized by explosive flavoring and uncompromised chilli heat.
applicantTips: Mastery of Southern Thai cuisine and authentic regional techniques
High tolerance and expertise in managing intense chilli heat and spice
Ability to create explosive flavor profiles with precision and balance
Experience blending traditional Southern Thai memories with innovation
Passion for bold, uncompromised flavors and genre-bending culinary approaches

name: Reale
description: Italian cuisine stripped back to its fundamentals. Modern Italian minimalism with significant focus on plant-based ingredients and technical research. Housed in a 16th-century monastery.
applicantTips: Mastery of Italian fundamentals and minimalist cooking philosophy
Strong expertise in plant-based cuisine and vegetable-forward cooking
Research-driven approach to technique and ingredient applications essential
Ability to strip dishes to essentials while maintaining depth of flavor
Passion for sustainable cooking and technical culinary innovation

name: The Chairman
description: Legendary Central favourite rewriting the rules of Cantonese cuisine. Focuses on innovative takes of classic Cantonese cooking with new recipes grounded in Chinese culinary history. No-frills approach emphasizing food quality over theatrics.
applicantTips: Deep mastery of Cantonese cooking techniques and culinary history
Ability to innovate classic recipes while respecting Chinese traditions
Excellence in ingredient quality assessment and sourcing
No-frills approach focused on food quality over presentation theatrics
Passion for redefining Cantonese cuisine while honoring its heritage

name: Atelier Moessmer
applicantTips: Expertise in Alpine cuisine and mountain region ingredient sourcing
Knowledge of sustainable practices and regional culinary traditions
Ability to work with altitude-appropriate ingredients and techniques
Strong connection to South Tyrolean culinary heritage valued
Passion for preserving Alpine traditions while innovating

name: Narisawa
description: Modern and sustainable Japanese cooking from a Tokyo dining mainstay. Channels traditional satoyama farming, drawing inspiration from Japanese, Chinese, and French cuisines.
applicantTips: Mastery of innovative Japanese techniques and sustainable cooking practices
Deep knowledge of satoyama farming and seasonal ingredient sourcing
Ability to blend Japanese, Chinese, and French culinary influences
Strong commitment to environmental sustainability and waste reduction
Passion for modernizing traditional Japanese cuisine while respecting heritage

name: Suhring
description: Cool and collected contemporary German cuisine in bustling Bangkok. The twins blend flavors and techniques from Germany, the Netherlands, Italy, and Thailand to create sophisticated, seasonal haute cuisine.
applicantTips: Mastery of contemporary German cuisine and classical German techniques
Ability to blend German, Dutch, Italian, and Thai influences seamlessly
Strong seasonal ingredient sourcing and development skills
Excellence in sophisticated haute cuisine plating and composition
Collaborative team spirit valued, especially in multi-chef environments

name: Borago
description: Beautiful Chilean produce from farm to fork. The menu highlights native ingredients through creative dishes sourced from over 200 local producers and foraging communities. Emphasizes zero-mile cooking and biodynamic farming.
applicantTips: Deep expertise in Chilean native ingredients and regional biodiversity
Strong commitment to sustainability, zero-mile cooking, and biodynamic practices
Experience managing relationships with 200+ local producers and foragers
Ability to source, identify, and creatively use foraged ingredients
Passion for environmental stewardship and farm-to-table philosophy

name: Elkano
description: Brilliant Basque seafood from a multi-generational family of grill masters. Renowned for innovative grilling techniques, particularly whole-fish preparation methods pioneered by founder Pedro Arregui.
applicantTips: Master grilling and whole-fish preparation techniques and innovation
Expertise in Basque seafood traditions and coastal ingredient handling
Multi-generational cooking philosophy and family culinary heritage valued
Advanced flame control and heat management for precision grilling
Respect for tradition combined with willingness to innovate techniques

name: Odette
description: French fine dining with a humble background. The menu blends French cuisine with Asian influences, featuring a seven-course seasonal tasting menu. Chef Royer prioritizes sourcing from artisanal producers across Asia and Europe.
applicantTips: Mastery of French culinary foundations and contemporary techniques
Experience blending French and Asian influences with sophistication
Strong network-building and artisanal producer sourcing across continents
Expertise in developing seasonal tasting menus (7+ courses)
Humble approach to fine dining combined with technical excellence valued

name: Merito
description: Combining produce from the surrounding area with flashes and memories of his country of origin, chef Juan Luis Martinez unites the cuisines of Peru and his native Venezuela.
applicantTips: Mastery of both Peruvian and Venezuelan cuisines with cultural respect
Experience blending two distinct South American culinary traditions
Strong local ingredient sourcing and regional producer knowledge
Ability to weave personal culinary memories into dishes authentically
Passion for cultural fusion and honoring multiple heritage traditions

name: Tresind Studio
description: Landmark, theatrical, cutting-edge Indian cuisine specializing in modern Indian gastronomy. Features an immersive dining experience where diners are relocated to different areas during the tasting menu.
applicantTips: Mastery of modern Indian gastronomy and cutting-edge culinary techniques
Strong background in theatrical, immersive dining experience design
Expertise in creating multi-sensory tasting journeys across multiple spaces
Technical precision combined with theatrical presentation excellence
Innovation mindset with respect for Indian culinary foundations

name: Lasai
description: Intimate chef's table experience leading the way in Brazil with exceptional, vegetable-led dishes and warm hospitality. Features only 10 seats around a single L-shaped chef's counter.
applicantTips: Mastery of vegetable-forward cooking and plant-based cuisine excellence
Counter dining experience and intimate guest interaction skills essential
Experience in small, exclusive dining environments (10+ seats)
Strong warm hospitality approach and personal guest connection
Passion for vegetable-led Brazilian contemporary cuisine innovation

name: Mingles
description: Refined Korean cookery that weaves together inspiration from Hong Kong and Europe. The restaurant focuses on in-season local ingredients and traditional Korean fermented sauces.
applicantTips: Mastery of refined Korean cooking with fermented sauces expertise
Ability to blend Korean, Hong Kong, and European culinary influences
Strong seasonal ingredient sourcing and local producer relationships
Knowledge of traditional Korean fermentation techniques and applications
Passion for elevating Korean cuisine with international sophistication

name: Le Du
description: A modern take on Thai ingredients with an emphasis on the seasons. Features contemporary tasting menus with recently renovated space featuring suspended glass tubes containing Thai seasonings.
applicantTips: Mastery of contemporary Thai cuisine with seasonal emphasis
Strong knowledge of Thai ingredients and flavor balance principles
Experience developing modern tasting menus with Thai foundations
Creativity in ingredient presentation and sensory experiences
Respect for Thai traditions combined with innovative contemporary approach

name: Le Calandre
description: Where culinary innovation meets Italian soul. Known for constantly evolving tasting menus inspired by seasonal ingredients, art, and culinary creativity. The cornerstone of the Alajmo Group.
applicantTips: Mastery of Italian cuisine foundations with innovative creative approach
Expertise in constantly evolving menu development and creativity
Strong understanding of seasonal ingredients and artistic presentations
Ability to balance tradition with bold culinary innovation
Passion for reinventing Italian cuisine while maintaining its soul

name: Piazza Duomo
description: A voyage through space and time, led by taste, colour, texture and aroma. Explores northern Italian culinary traditions with seasonal menus sourced from the restaurant's own greenhouses and biodynamic gardens.
applicantTips: Mastery of Northern Italian culinary traditions and regional techniques
Expertise in biodynamic gardening and direct farm-to-table operations
Strong understanding of how taste, color, texture, and aroma create experiences
Experience developing seasonal tasting menus with on-site ingredient sourcing
Commitment to sustainable agriculture and ingredient integrity

name: Steirereck
description: A history lesson in Austrian gastronomy delivered with contemporary flair. Combines historic Austrian ingredients with modern culinary techniques, featuring research-driven, sustainable cooking.
applicantTips: Deep knowledge of Austrian culinary history and traditional ingredients
Mastery of modern techniques applied to historic Austrian cuisine
Research-driven approach to ingredient sourcing and culinary development
Strong commitment to sustainability and ingredient-focused cooking
Ability to tell culinary stories through contemporary interpretation

name: Enigma
description: Live out culinary fantasies at this unique spot from an El Bulli alumnus. Features a tasting menu of approximately 25 courses with a secret code entry system for guests.
applicantTips: Avant-garde and experimental cooking mindset with El Bulli heritage knowledge
Expertise in developing ultra-long tasting menus (25+ courses)
Strong creativity and ability to fulfill culinary fantasies and concepts
Technical mastery across multiple cooking disciplines and methodologies
Openness to radical experimentation and breaking culinary conventions

name: Nusara
description: Colourful plates telling a story of family love and heritage. Modern Thai cuisine that blends history with innovation, drawing from family recipes and royal kitchen cookbooks.
applicantTips: Mastery of Thai cuisine with deep knowledge of royal kitchen traditions
Ability to tell culinary stories through thoughtful plate presentation
Experience blending family recipes with contemporary innovation
Strong understanding of historical Thai flavors and modern techniques
Passion for honoring heritage while pushing culinary boundaries

name: Florilege
description: Creative French-Japanese cooking with sustainability on display. Diners enjoy plush counter seating surrounding an open kitchen. The menu emphasizes locally sourced ingredients and plant-forward options.
applicantTips: Mastery of French-Japanese fusion cooking and both culinary traditions
Counter service expertise and intimate guest interaction skills
Strong commitment to sustainability and plant-forward cuisine
Local ingredient sourcing knowledge and sustainable practice implementation
Ability to balance French refinement with Japanese precision and simplicity

name: Orfali Bros
description: The region's most emblematic restaurant, helmed by Syrian-born siblings. The three brothers blend traditional Syrian cuisine with pan-regional influences, European techniques, and Asian ingredients.
applicantTips: Expert knowledge of Syrian cuisine and regional Middle Eastern flavors
Ability to blend traditional Syrian cuisine with European and Asian techniques
Experience in family-driven restaurant culture and collaborative team dynamics
Understanding of pan-regional Middle Eastern culinary influences
Passion for representing Syrian heritage through contemporary culinary excellence

name: Frantzen
description: Exceptional, boundary-pushing immersive dining from one of Sweden's OG culinary rockstars. Operates across three stories of a 19th-century townhouse, blending Nordic traditions with modern techniques and Asian influences.
applicantTips: Mastery of Nordic cuisine and immersive dining experience design
Ability to blend Nordic traditions with modern techniques and Asian influences
Experience managing multi-venue, multi-story dining experiences
Boundary-pushing creativity combined with technical excellence
Passion for creating exceptional, memorable guest journeys

name: Mayta
description: Artful dishes and vibrant cocktails from a Peruvian culinary ambassador. Focuses on refined Peruvian cuisine with emphasis on sustainability and biodiversity preservation.
applicantTips: Mastery of refined Peruvian cuisine and contemporary plating artistry
Strong expertise in cocktail creation and beverage program development
Commitment to sustainability and biodiversity preservation principles
Knowledge of Peruvian ingredients and their creative applications
Passion for representing Peru globally as a culinary ambassador

name: Septime
description: Super seasonal, ultra-cool modern French cooking featuring thoughtful, ingredient-driven plates with global influences. Chef Grebaut previously worked at Alain Passard's Arpege.
applicantTips: Mastery of seasonal, ingredient-driven French contemporary cooking
Strong understanding of global culinary influences and their applications
Experience in ultra-cool, modern French dining environments
Commitment to sustainability and thoughtful ingredient sourcing
Ability to balance classical French training with contemporary innovation

name: Kadeau
description: Bornholm roots with New Nordic soul. The Copenhagen outpost maintains loyalty to New Nordic Cuisine philosophy. Nearly all plant-based ingredients derive from the restaurant's Bornholm garden.
applicantTips: Mastery of New Nordic Cuisine philosophy and Bornholm culinary traditions
Expert knowledge of Nordic ingredients and seasonal harvesting
Experience with direct-sourced, garden-to-table operations
Strong commitment to plant-based cooking and vegetable-forward cuisine
Ability to maintain regional identity while working in cosmopolitan settings

name: Belcanto
description: An exploration of Portuguese flavours from the country's landmark eatery. Serves contemporary Portuguese cuisine through two tasting menus in an intimate setting with vaulted ceilings.
applicantTips: Deep expertise in Portuguese culinary traditions and contemporary interpretation
Experience developing dual tasting menu options and flexibility
Understanding of Portuguese ingredient quality and sourcing excellence
Ability to work in intimate, architecturally distinctive dining spaces
Passion for exploring and representing Portuguese culinary excellence

name: Uliassi
description: Innovative, memorable Italian cooking with a view to match. Seamlessly blends classical and contemporary cuisine with a distinctive approach to combining marine and meat-based flavors.
applicantTips: Mastery of Italian seafood cooking and Adriatic regional traditions
Expertise in balancing classical Italian technique with contemporary innovation
Distinctive knowledge of combining marine and meat flavors harmoniously
Strong understanding of coastal ingredient sourcing and quality
Ability to create memorable dining experiences with beautiful ambiance

name: La Cime
description: Impeccable Osaka destination that reaches for the sky. Modern French cuisine featuring elaborate, precise, and creative dishes with premium seafood and produce from western Japan.
applicantTips: Mastery of French-Japanese fusion cooking with technical precision
Expertise in sourcing premium seafood and western Japan regional produce
Ability to create elaborate, sophisticated, and creative dish compositions
Strong understanding of both French haute cuisine and Japanese aesthetics
Commitment to impeccable execution and continuous culinary refinement

name: Arpege
description: A bastion of Parisian fine dining where vegetables reign supreme. Passard famously removed meat from the menu in 2001, earning recognition as the maestro of vegetarian cuisine. Fresh produce comes from three biodynamic farms.
applicantTips: Mastery of vegetable-forward, vegetarian haute cuisine excellence
Deep knowledge of French culinary foundations and classical techniques
Experience sourcing from biodynamic farms and sustainable producers
Ability to create sophisticated fine dining without relying on meat
Visionary approach to redefining haute cuisine through vegetarian excellence

name: Rosetta
description: Imaginative Mexican cuisine with an eye on the future. Chef Reygadas studied at the French Culinary Institute and worked at Locanda Locatelli before opening Rosetta.
applicantTips: Mastery of imaginative Mexican cuisine with forward-thinking approach
Experience blending Italian and Mexican culinary traditions
French classical training combined with global culinary exposure valued
Ability to interpret Mexican cuisine through contemporary lens
Passion for culinary innovation and pushing boundaries

name: Vyn
description: Emphasizes a connection to its coastal setting. Berlin's approximately 16-course menu reflects sustainability principles and utilizes foraged, grown, and hunted ingredients from the surrounding Skane region.
applicantTips: Mastery of Nordic cuisine with deep coastal and regional connections
Expertise in foraging, local hunting, and growing ingredients
Experience developing extended tasting menus (16+ courses)
Strong commitment to sustainability and local ecosystem respect
Ability to tell stories through food about place and seasonality

name: Celele
description: Groundbreaking Colombian-Caribbean fusion that explores Caribbean coast ingredients and flavors through culinary research. Sources approximately 90% of products from the Caribbean region.
applicantTips: Expert knowledge of Colombian and Caribbean cuisines and ingredients
Research-driven approach to ingredient exploration and culinary innovation
Strong local sourcing network and sustainable supply chain management
Experience in groundbreaking culinary fusion while respecting traditions
Commitment to Caribbean regional ingredient preservation and celebration

name: Kol
description: Platforming modern Mexican gastronomy with British ingredients. Chef Lastra sources primarily UK ingredients, using creative substitutes like sea buckthorn instead of lime.
applicantTips: Mastery of modern Mexican cuisine principles and techniques
Innovative mindset for creative ingredient substitution and adaptation
Strong knowledge of British ingredients and seasonal sourcing
Ability to honor Mexican gastronomy while working with local resources
Creativity in reimagining traditional Mexican flavors with available ingredients

name: Jan
applicantTips: Mastery of contemporary German cuisine and regional Bavarian traditions
Strong technical foundation in classical German cooking methods
Experience interpreting German ingredients with modern sensibilities
Understanding of German culinary values: precision, quality, seasonality
Passion for representing German gastronomy on international stage
